newsitem.title: USA: Clinton threatens veto on funds bill--W.House.
newsitem.headline: Clinton threatens veto on funds bill--W.House.

text.p: President Clinton will veto an emergency disaster aid bill if Republicans add an unrelated measure that would continue federal spending automatically if Congress and the administration cannot agree on the 1998 budget, White House budget chief Franklin Raines said Tuesday.
"It is a sign of bad faith and we strongly urge them to reverse course," Raines said of Republican efforts to add a permanent "continuing" appropriations measure to the emergency spending bill.
"The president will veto the bill," if the permanent continuing appropriation is included, he said.
